title: How to Play Nintendo Switch with 2 Players: A Set-Up Guide

steps.title: Detach the Joy-Con controllers from your Switch.
steps.content: Detach the Joy-Con controllers from your Switch. To detach the Joy-Con controllers, pick up the Nintendo Switch and turn it over. Press and hold the round button on the back of the Joy-Con controller next to the ZL and ZR buttons. Slide the Joy-Con up to detach it. Do the same for the Joy-Con controller on the other side. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Attach the Joy-Con straps.
steps.content: Attach the Joy-Con straps. The straps are the thin pieces with two buttons and a wrist strap attached. The Joy-Con straps have a “+” or “-” engraved on the top. Line these up with the “+” and “-” buttons on the Joy-Con controller. Slide the opening at the bottom of the strap over the track on the side of the Joy-Con controller until it snaps in place. [2] X Research source To remove the Joy-Con straps, pull the gray tab at the bottom of the strap and slide it up. If one player is using the Pro Controller, the other player can place both Joy-Cons in the Joy-Con controller holder that turns both of them into a single controller.

steps.title: Open the controller settings menu and select Change Grip/Order.
steps.content: Open the controller settings menu and select Change Grip/Order . The icon on your Switch’s home screen that resembles a Joy-Con is the controller settings menu. This is where you can set up the controllers for two players. Once you’ve opened the menu, select Change Grip/Order . It’s the first option in the menu. [3] X Research source You can select items on the Nintendo Switch by tapping them on the screen or navigating to them with the controller and pressing A .

steps.title: Press R+L on both controllers.
steps.content: Press R + L on both controllers. If you are using the Joy-Cons to play two players, turn both Joy-Cons sideways with the analog stick to the left. Press the two buttons (R & L) on top of the strap. If you are using a Pro Controller or other controller setup, press R & L on both controllers that you want to use. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select a two-player game and start two-player mode.
steps.content: Select a two-player game and start two-player mode. There are a variety of two-player Nintendo Switch games you can purchase from the Nintendo eShop or a store. Check the information on the back of the game or on the information page of the Nintendo eShop to see how many players a game supports. When you find a game you like, select the multiplayer/two-player mode on the title screen to start a two-player game. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Mario Kart
steps.content: Mario Kart Mario Kart is a classic competitive racing game enjoyed by people of all ages! The game allows for 8-player local co-op or 12-player racing online. Choose one of 42 characters to play as and race your friends on one of 48 tracks on Mario Kart 8 Deluxe . [6] X Research source .

steps.title: Animal Crossing
steps.content: Animal Crossing Animal Crossing: New Horizons is a cozy game in which you set out to create an island paradise filled with cute animal characters. Up to 4 players can play together on the same island on the same Nintendo Switch system, and you can also invite up to 8 friends to visit your island via local wireless or online play. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fortnite
steps.content: Fortnite Fortnite is a popular game in which players battle against each other to be the last one standing. While Fortnite is most known for being an online multiplayer game, it’s also possible to play it with a friend via split-screen on Nintendo Switch. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Mortal Kombat 11
steps.content: Mortal Kombat 11 Mortal Kombat 11 is the newest game in the Mortal Kombat franchise, in which you fight against other players. The game supports two-player gameplay, allowing you to play against a friend using the Joy-Cons. You can also play with up to 3 players online. [9] X Research source

steps.title: FIFA 24
steps.content: FIFA 24 If sports games are more your thing, FIFA 24 , officially called FC 24 , is a great multiplayer option. This soccer game allows you to play multiplayer by connecting a second pair of Joy-Cons or a Pro Controller to your Nintendo Switch. You can also use the Split Joy-Con feature to play 1v1 or 1+1 Co-op without additional equipment. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons
steps.content: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons follows two brothers on a quest to collect the Water of Life to cure their sick father. This action-adventure game allows you to play solo or with a friend, as one brother is controlled by a thumbstick and the other by the D-pad. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
steps.content: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate If you want to play against your friends rather than work with them, Super Smash Bros. may be the game for you. In Super Smash Bros. Ultimate , choose one of your favorite Nintendo characters and battle your friend in combat. [12] X Research source

steps.title: It Takes Two
steps.content: It Takes Two It Takes Two is a popular co-op game that follows a couple who, after deciding to separate, are turned into two small dolls. They then have to work together to change back and help their daughter. This game is all about teamwork and communication, making it the perfect game for two players. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Snipperclips
steps.content: Snipperclips Snipperclips is an underrated action puzzle game that can be played co-op or competitively. Play as characters Snip and Clip to solve puzzles by cutting them into different shapes. Two players can work together on the main adventure, and up to 4 can play in the Party and Blitz modes. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes
steps.content: Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes is a unique co-op puzzle game in which players must actively communicate to win. One player is in a room with a bomb, while the other is in a room with the manual. The player with the bomb must describe what they see to the player with the manual, who will then explain what to do to diffuse it. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Can you play 2-player on the Nintendo Switch without a TV?
steps.content: Can you play 2-player on the Nintendo Switch without a TV? Yes, you can use the tabletop or handheld modes to play 2-player on the Nintendo Switch without a TV. To use tabletop mode, fold out the kickstand and play with the built-in screen. To use handheld mode, hold the Switch console with the Joy-Con controllers attached and play on the built-in screen. [16] X Research source

steps.title: How do you connect two controllers to the Nintendo Switch?
steps.content: How do you connect two controllers to the Nintendo Switch? From the home screen, select Controllers , then Change Grip/Order . Pair the controllers you want to play with in order, following the instructions on the screen. Note that on the “Change Grip/Order” screen, you can only pair up to 4 controllers. [17] X Research source

steps.title: How do you change Player 1 to Player 2 on the Nintendo Switch?
steps.content: How do you change Player 1 to Player 2 on the Nintendo Switch? To change which controller is Player 1, go to the home screen, select Controllers , then Change Grip/Order . Follow the on-screen instructions to pair the Joy-Cons in the correct order. When playing online, the player who set up the online game must press ZL + ZR to open the Suspend Menu, then press Y or select Swap P1 to swap between Player 1 and Player 2. [18] X Research source

steps.title: How do you play 2-player on Nintendo Switch with one controller?
steps.content: How do you play 2-player on Nintendo Switch with one controller? To play 2-player with only one controller, detach both Joy-Cons and press the SL and SR buttons simultaneously on each controller to register them as a single controller. [19] X Research source
